newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatia's average lending rate flat at 10.8 pct.
newsitem.headline: Croatia's average lending rate flat at 10.8 pct.

text.p: Croatia's average lending rate ended flat at 10.8 percent on Wednesday in a tight market.
Daily trade totalled 31.4 million kuna against 47 million in supply. Fresh borrowings accounted for 21.2 million kuna.
The weighted call money rate rose 10 basis points to 10.6 percent after mixed trading.
Interbank term rates ranged between a minimum 8.2 percent for seven-day loans and 18 percent, charged to savings banks for two-month funds.
Insurers rolled over one-week kuna at a stable 9.0 percent.
The central bank calculated its kuna midrates for Thursday firmer at 6.1510 against the dollar and 3.5722 versus the mark. -- Sandra Kalogjera, Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
